member_organisations:
For a list of EJN Supporters see: https://ethicaljournalismnetwork.org/supporters 
 
For details of EJN staff, board members and advisers see: https://ethicaljournalismnetwork.org/who-we-are/our-people
fields_of_interest: Culture and media, Culture, International co-operation and development, Education and training, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Digital economy and society, Communication, Migration and asylum
eu_initiatives: Carrying out EU support for media development in the Western Balkans and Turkey as part of the 'Building Trust in Media in South East Europe and Turkey' in partnership with Unesco and European Federation of Journalists (EFJ). The EJN does not receive funding directly from the EU for this work as the project is managed by UNESCO. The EJN also supports ethical journalism activities and dialogues to confront hate-speech, including the 'Media Against Hate' project with the EFJ. The EJN is a member of the DG Connect Media Literacy Expert Group.
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
relevant_communication: Weekly newsletter and regular reports on specific issues such as media coverage of migration; regional studies on corruption inside media and self regulation; national reports on issues such as hate-speech. A global interactive website Accountable Journalism (www.accountablejournalism.org) provides the most up-to-date data on codes, standards and journalism ethics issues worldwide.
goals__remit: The Ethical Journalism Network aims to strengthen the craft of journalism in Europe and around the world and to promote for the public benefit high ethical standards in media through education, training and publication of useful research. The EJN works to improve good governance and self-regulation in media through education on the importance of accuracy, independence, impartiality, humanity and accountability in journalism.
